And President Biden, if you think about why he was elected into office, it's really to be a placeholder president. Because like you said, the poll numbers on the economy, Afghanistan, foreign policy, crime, those are obvious, because we're obviously doing bad in those areas. But the poll numbers on Biden's personality are really interesting. Is he honest? That dropped 20 points over the last eight months. Does he care about the average American? That dropped 11. And his personality was his bread and butter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

Yes, he's a modern Warhol, emphasis on hole. The identities of the buyers remained anonymous, perhaps, because they're not allowed to buy art as a condition of their parole.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

utterances.utterance: Yes. Acts like a muppet. All right, so, now a team of lawyers is reportedly vetting patrons for Hunter's upcoming gallery show in New York City, which has been delayed until spring or as Hunter calls it, fresh cocaine season. They're out investigating PTA parents --

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS
utterances.utterance: Like I -- get out of here.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: 75,000 a painting?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: I think that Hunter Biden is probably the best example of how really the media is still aggressively trying to protect President Biden. Because it's not just that he was a crack addict or failed to pay child support or tried to profit off his dad's political career. But we live in a time that is so hyper-focused on race, and he used the n-word in a series of racist texts, and the media didn't even cover it.

And our birthday had Stelter ready to break, but he's still first in line for a piece of that cake. We are the Dr. Seuss of politics. As Fox News celebrated 25 epic years this week, we reminded you every three minutes. No heartfelt birthday wishes from CNN's chubby, grubby, Teletubby -- only smug words of dismay and disgust.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN STELTER, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: Fox wasn't always the political beast it is today, but the network evolved or devolved into the beating heart of the GOP. The heart with clogged arteries and weak muscles.

utterances.speaker: STELTER
utterances.utterance: Executives might say they're merely holding a mirror up to America's divisions, but the political science research is clear. Fox is not just a mirror. It's an accelerant. For the families who feel like they've been torn apart by Fox, this week is not a happy anniversary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, he's so funny. You want to talk about tearing the country apart? CNN has been sewing division for years stoking a race war, smearing the police and helping to maintain a rise in crime by justifying its very existence calling a protest. Sadly, the only way to get CNN or Brian to address Chris Cuomo is accusations or his brother Andrew's harassment of staffers is if Fox News talks about it. Without us, the reliable rotundo wouldn't have a show. Literally, I discovered you, pal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: STELTER

utterances.speaker: STELTER
utterances.utterance: And no one no one pays the rent. I mean, the landlord came after seven years to evict them.

That could have been could have been us. Could have been us, Kat. You know, without, without Fox, Stelter would be working at Cinnabon.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sorry, I just -- it just hits me the wrong way Kat.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's OK. That's OK. You know I do my best and that's all I can do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, we're going to -- we're going to have to meet afterwards. No, you can applaud her mistakes. It's me who have to -- who has to deal with it. You guys get to go home, but I got to deal with -- I got to clean up these messes. Speaking of messes, Loftus.

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS
utterances.utterance: Every time, every time you're three for three.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't Stelter guilty of being unaware of him or his network's blind spot? It's like when you -- everybody sees how funny this is except them. They, they become this nation scold while everybody else has fun.

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS
utterances.utterance: It's like he's begging people to really go at him so he can complain. Look how they came at me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS

Like, look at that picture, I every time I see that, it's like when they took off Darth Vader's mask, like right before he died when Luca, he's, we'll take off his mask, that's the guy under the makeup. Like he -- and then and during the clip like he's longing for the old days of Fox, and these time -- oh remember when they had Shepard Smith on there and he --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know it's B.S. He didn't like Fox back then. What he, what he's trying to do is, is, is play this game. Like, oh, it's changed. No, it just, it got better and it always gets better.

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know Morgan, he seems to be saying that everything went to hell in a handbasket when an alternative was created to their leftist point of view. It's like that's tearing families apart, another path. MORGAN ORTAGUS, FORMER SPOKESPERSON FOR THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

The thing that, that's like scary about it whenever I watch these sorts of things, it's like not everyone thinks the way you do, not everyone believes the way you do. That's why there's choices, that's why we have television remote. We can turn the channel if we don't like it. So, it's more like when I look at it this way, I think it's sad that you think so poorly of your fellow Americans that you must be brainwashed into watching your television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, we almost think the same. We might -- in any, in any, any deviance from that part is wrong. I don't want him to stop doing this, Carley, because this gives me so much material.

utterances.speaker: CARLEY SHIMKUS, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.utterance: I can't believe that clip. What was that, 2007?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think so, yes. Yes. I don't know who looked worse: me or him?

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS
utterances.utterance: Rocking that Siegfried and shirt.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: You're aging like a fine wine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: You're very welcome. You know, when I was coming in, just to do the show, I met this couple taking pictures outside of Fox News, and they're so sweet. They're from Pennsylvania. And I was thinking the reason we celebrated 25 years of Fox News was for the viewers. It was for the studio audience. Because before Fox, there was -- half of the country didn't have a voice. And it's a celebration of that and giving our viewers a voice and the support of us and what we've -- it's all a big hat. We keep on talking about how Fox is a family but we also mean the viewers as well because they're the ones who are supporting and allowing this happened. I think it's really sad that Brian Stelter, a member of the media, doesn't see that. He should be the one that's celebrating freedom of speech, freedom of the press, and he's filled with so much hate that he can't even see it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't say, I wouldn't say hate, I'd say biscuits. Carbs, which are like hate --

utterances.speaker: LOFTUS
utterances.utterance: That's taters and gravy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Carbs are the devil. All right, coming up, the evolutionary reasons why women like warmer season.

utterances.utterance: Is there a scientific reason why women are always freezing? It's a story as old as time itself. That colder temperatures make women whine. A new study out of Israel suggested that women get colder than men due to evolution. That explains why so many give me the cold shoulder. I would never write that. The study was based on bats and birds. And although previous research, research suggests that women get colder for metabolic reasons. Women's core temperatures are higher than men's, and women have a lower metabolic rate so they experienced the temperatures of their environments differently. But also, decades of meticulous research shows that women just like to complain. But Kat, a sexist wrote that, I'll just have you know. But can we stop messing around with bats, for Pete's sake? Any more research with those winged demons and we'll be wearing masks on our hands and feet. In the meantime, I've teamed up with NASA to create a highly technical device that will eliminate the differences in temperature sensitivity between men and women. Here it is. Called a shawl. I think there'll be available, Morgan, in most department stores by the end of the year. You're a woman, I believe.

utterances.speaker: ORTAGUS
utterances.utterance: Last time I checked.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: How dare you gender her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I cisgender --

utterances.speaker: ORTAGUS
utterances.utterance: I do identify, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ORTAGUS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I also identify as Morgan Ortagus. You cold right now? It's very, very cold.

utterances.speaker: ORTAGUS

But, but I was just telling the girls, one of the things that was amazing last year about being pregnant is that I was hot all the time. And it was so hot, I remember one night it was like 40 degrees and I opened the glass door in the bedroom. My husband walked in he's like it's freezing in here. It's like if you touch the door, you die. It was like really nice. It's for like nine months, he got to experience what it's like for me to be cold all the time. And I was like, yes, this is amazing. You get to see what it's like, finally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Furthermore, important sex.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. The guy takes the risks. He goes out and kills things.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Naturally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, the guy has to endure cold temperatures, because he goes out and, and goes after the what are those large animals --

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Mammoth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mammoth.

utterances.speaker: SHIMKUS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think it's just because women wear fewer clothes. I mean, look, look at what we're wearing versus you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: In my neighborhood.
